fdd:FDD.titleName: MPEG-4, Advanced Video Coding, High 10 Profile

fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:fullName: Information technology -- Coding of audio-visual objects (formal name); MPEG-4, Advanced Video Coding (part 10), High 10 Profile

fdd:description.p: The High 10 Profile MPEG-4_AVC (from ITU-T H.264) supports 4:2:0 chroma at 10 bits per channel, adaptive macroblock-level switching between 8x8 and 4x4 transform block size, encoder-specified quantization scaling matrices, encoder-specified separate control of the quantization parameter for each chroma component, and monochrome sequences. The Overview and Introduction to the Fidelity Range Extensions does not separately discuss MPEG-4_AVC_H10P but states that "the High profile seems to be overtaking the Main profile as the primary choice for broadcast and other entertainment-quality applications."
NOTE: this Web page drafted prior to the amendment of the standard to add the four High profiles.Comments welcome.

fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:shortDescription: The High 10 Profile supports 4:2:0 chroma at 10 bits per channel, adaptive macroblock-level switching between 8x8 and 4x4 transform block size, encoder-specified quantization scaling matrices, encoder-specified separate control of the quantization parameter for each chroma component, and monochrome sequences.

fdd:relatedTo.fdd:titleName: MPEG-4 File Format, V.2, with AVC, High 10 Profile

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:documentation: See MPEG-4_AVC. This profile is not yet in the formal specification; information may be found in Overview and Introduction to the Fidelity Range Extensions.

fdd:movingImageQF.fdd:clarity: See MPEG-4_AVC. Depends in part on the level and encoding algorithm selected. The High 10 Profile has the potential to produce greater clarity than MPEG-4_AVC_BP, MPEG-4_AVC_MP, MPEG-4_AVC_EP, and MPEG-4_AVC_HP at a given picture size and data rate. By the same token, MPEG-4_AVC_H10P clarity can be surpassed by MPEG-4_AVC_H422P and MPEG-4_AVC_H444P.

fdd:filenameExtension.fdd:note: Pertains to the file format; see MP4_FF_2

fdd:internetMediaType.fdd:note: Pertains to the file format; see MP4_FF_2

fdd:magicNumbers.fdd:note: Pertains to the file format; see MP4_FF_2

fdd:other.fdd:tag: File type brand (ISO Base Media File Format)

fdd:values.fdd:note: Indicated in file wrapper and relates to "brands" defined in ISO_BMFF. Wrapping MPEG-4_AVC bitstreams in MP4_FF_1 (unlikely) would occasion the use of mp41; in MP4_FF_2 (more likely), use mp42.

fdd:other.fdd:tag: Indicator for profile, level, version, etc.

fdd:values.fdd:note: profile_idc; described as a part of Annex A of Part 10 of the standard, pp. 204-05.
PRONOM has no corresponding entry as of July 2022.

fdd:citation.fdd:specReference: ISO/IEC 14496-10:2003 Information technology -- Coding of audio-visual objects -- Part 10: Advanced Video Coding
ISO/IEC 14496-15:2003 Information technology -- Coding of audio-visual objects -- Part 15: Advanced Video Coding (AVC) file format

fdd:urlReference.tag: Overview and Introduction to the Fidelity Range Extensions
H.264/MPEG4-AVC Fidelity Range Extensions: Tools, Profiles, Performance, and Application Areas

fdd:citation.fdd:bookReference: Sullivan, Gary J., Pankaj Topiwala, and Ajay Luthra. "Overview and Introduction to the Fidelity Range Extensions." Paper presented at the SPIE Conference on Applications of Digital Image Processing XXVII, Special Session on Advances in the New Emerging Standard: H.264/AVC, August, 2004.
